body.p: To His Excellency Thos E Bramlette Governor of the commonwealth of Ky.

William Palmer states that He was indicted by the Clarke Circuit Court at its July Term 1860. For gameing ^and was fined $20 -- ^ He states that He was with other gentlemen at the Oil Springs in Clark County on the 4th of July 1860 and they engaged in a game of cards more for amusement than any thing else they had up some small sum of Mony at the time upon a proper representation of the facts to your Predecessor Gov Magoffin the indictment was respited and recently an execution was issued upon the process -- He states that He has not been in the habit of playing cards and has not played ^a game^ since -- He prays to have the fine remitted.
sworn to by William Palmer before me this 19th November 1864.

We the undersigned Citizens of Clark County would respectfully state, that we are well acquainted with the Petitioner William Palmer and We know he is a poor man of family and We do not believe he indulges in gameing and we would
respectfully request that the fine imposed upon him be remitted He is a mechanic a black Smith by trade and is trying to make a living for his family --

S B Eubank
E, R, Elkin
John, A, Eubank
Stephen P. Wallace
Joseph Brandenburg
Richard C Eubank
Wiliam Hall
W. E. Blakemon
